title: Internal Compiler Error running in docker container

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust struct Greeting { name: String, } fn main() { let greeting = Greeting { name: "Bjørn".to_string() }; println!("Hello, {}!", greeting.name); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01) binary: rustc commit-hash: 59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35 commit-date: 2021-11-01 host: aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling rust v0.1.0 (/var/rust) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Failed to recover key for crate_hash(c30dce060fa55696-4106f204c387a065) with hash c30dce060fa55696-4106f204c387a065', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/lib.rs:56:1 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01) running on aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `rust` ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling rust v0.1.0 (/var/rust) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Failed to recover key for crate_hash(c30dce060fa55696-4106f204c387a065) with hash c30dce060fa55696-4106f204c387a065', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/lib.rs:56:1 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35/library/std/src/panicking.rs:517:5 1: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt at /rustc/59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35/library/std/src/panicking.rs:460:5 2: rustc_query_impl::query_callbacks::all_traits::try_load_from_on_disk_cache::{{closure}} 3: rustc_query_impl::query_callbacks::reachable_non_generics::try_load_from_on_disk_cache 4: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::exec_cache_promotions 5: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 6: ::serialize 7: rustc_middle::ty::context::TyCtxt::serialize_query_result_cache 8: rustc_incremental::persist::save::save_in 9: rustc_data_structures::sync::join 10: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 11: rustc_incremental::persist::save::save_dep_graph 12: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 13: rustc_span::with_source_map 14: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01) running on aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `rust` ```
